SHANGHAI — Novak Djokovic extended his winning streak to 13 straight matches with a swift 6-2, 6-1 win over Martin Klizan in the second round of the Shanghai Masters on Wednesday.
Rafael Nadal also advanced to the third round, although in far more difficult fashion, 7-5, 6-7 (4), 7-6 (4) over Ivo Karlovic .
Djokovic is coming off his sixth China Open title last week, where he only lost 18 games in the entire tournament. He is aiming for his ninth title of the year and his third at the Shanghai Masters.
Nick Kyrgios put himself further at risk of a suspension as he smacked a ball in frustration toward a line judge during his loss to Kei Nishikori .
Kyrgios was already fined $1,500 for an "audible obscenity" in his first-round match in Shanghai. He faces a 28-day suspension from the ATP tour if he reaches $5,000 in fines before February after being placed on probation for making derogatory comments to Stan Wawrinka during a match in Montreal in August.
More tennis: Jelena Jankovic and Samantha Stosur advanced to the quarterfinals of the Hong Kong Open, both winning in straight sets. Heather Watson and Daria Gavrilova also advanced. ... Second-seeded Caroline Wozniacki was the only player among the top five seeded women to reach the second round at the Generali Ladies, rallying to beat Mirjana Lucic-Baroni 3-6, 7-6 (3), 6-4.
Soccer: FIFA has suspended a South African official for six years as part of a match-fixing investigation involving friendly games ahead of the 2010 World Cup. Lindile Kika , who was the South African Football Association 's head of national teams at the time, has been banned from all soccer-related activities. FIFA judge Hans-Joachim Eckert found Kika guilty of breaching five sections of the ethics code.
— Wire reports
